member.name: T:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Events.Gantt.TaskResizeHandlingType
member.summary: UserActionHandling enumeration defines possible types of user event handling.
member.remarks:
The user action can be handled in several ways:
on the client-side by custom JavaScript code(JavaScript)
on the server-side using a PostBack request (PostBack)
on the server-side using an AJAX callback request (CallBack)
it can be disabled at all (Disabled)

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Events.Gantt.TaskResizeHandlingType.PostBack

member.summary: The user action will call an AJAX CallBack event.

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Events.Gantt.TaskResizeHandlingType.Notify
member.summary: The task will be deleted on the client side and the server-side event hanlder will be fired.

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Events.Gantt.TaskResizeHandlingType.Enabled
member.summary: The user action is enabled but no default action is specified. Only the client-side event handlers will be fired.

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Events.Gantt.TaskResizeHandlingType.Disabled
member.summary: This functionality is disabled.

member.remarks: It is called when a user selects context menu item where the MenuItem.Action is set to or . In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind() and Update(). After calling Update() the events will be updated on the client-side.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotGantt.UseEventBoxes
member.summary: When set to Always (default) events are shown in boxes that are aligned with the cell size. Set to Never or ShortEventsOnly if you want to show events in real length.
member.remarks:
By default, event boxes are aligned with the cell size.
When that value is set to ShortEventsOnly the events will be rendered in real size. Events shorter than a cell size will be rendered in a box unles you set this property to Never.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Events.Calendar.BeforeEventRenderEventArgs.EventMoveEnabled
member.summary: Set to false to disable moving of this calendar event on the client-side.
member.remarks: The moving will be enabled only if these two conditions are met: DayPilotCalendar.EventMoveHandling is not set to Disabled and EventMoveEnabled is set to true.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Events.Calendar.BeforeEventRenderEventArgs.EventClickEnabled
member.summary: Set to false to disable clicking on this calendar event on the client-side.
member.remarks: The clicking will be enabled only if these two conditions are met: DayPilotCalendar.EventClickHandling is not set to Disabled and EventClickEnabled is set to true.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Events.Calendar.BeforeEventRenderEventArgs.EventDoubleClickEnabled
member.summary: Set to false to disable double clicking on this calendar event on the client-side.
member.remarks: The double clicking will be enabled only if these two conditions are met: DayPilotCalendar.EventDoubleClickHandling is not set to Disabled and EventDoubleClickEnabled is set to true.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Events.Calendar.BeforeEventRenderEventArgs.EventDeleteEnabled
member.summary: Set to false to disable deleting this calendar event using the X button in the upper right corner.
member.remarks: The deleting will be enabled (and X button visible) only if these two conditions are met: DayPilotCalendar.EventDeleteHandling is not set to Disabled and EventDeleteEnabled is set to true.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Events.Calendar.BeforeEventRenderEventArgs.EventRightClickEnabled
member.summary: Set to false to disable right mouse click on this calendar event on the client-side.
member.remarks: The right mouse click will be enabled only if these two conditions are met: DayPilotCalendar.EventRightClickHandling is not set to Disabled and EventRightClickEnabled is set to true.

member.summary: UserActionHandling enumeration defines possible types of user event handling.
member.remarks:
The user action can be handled in several ways:
on the client-side by custom JavaScript code(JavaScript)
on the server-side using a PostBack request (PostBack)
on the server-side using an AJAX callback request (CallBack)
it can be disabled at all (Disabled)

member.summary: Helper class that allows expanding recurrent events in a DataTable.

member.name: M:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Recurrence.RecurrenceExpander.Expand(System.Data.DataTable,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a copy (Cloned) of the DataTable and fills it with the events from the original DataTable. It expands the recurrent event definitions into individual occurrences.
member.param: Name of the column that holds recurrence information.
Name of the column that holds event start.
Name of the column that holds event end.
Name of the column that holds event id.
Name of the column that will be added to the DataTable and that will store the ID of the recurrence master event.
Starting time of the expanding time frame.
Ending time of the expanding time frame.
Maximum start date change of an exception from the rule. Event that is moved back for more than "maxChange" using an exception might not be visible.

member.summary: The type of event repeating (None, Daily, Weekly, etc.).

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Recurrence.RecurrenceRule.Every
member.summary: This event repeats every "x" day/week/month/year.

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Recurrence.RecurrenceRule.Named
member.summary: Named days/weeks on which the event repeats. If a value is specified (not null), it will be used instead of Every value.

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Recurrence.RecurrenceRule.Units
member.summary: List of lower units on which the events repeats (e.g. days of week for Weekly rule).

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Recurrence.RecurrenceRule.NoRepeat
member.summary: Specifies that the event does not recur.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotMonth.EventMenuClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user selects context menu item where the MenuItem.Action is set to or .
member.remarks: It is called when a user selects context menu item where the MenuItem.Action is set to or . In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind() and Update(). After calling Update() the events will be updated on the client-side.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotMonth.EventRightClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user clicks an event with a right mouse button.
member.remarks: This event is only fired if EventRightClickHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack or UserActionHandling.CallBack.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotMonth.EventClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user clicks an event.
member.remarks: This event is only fired if EventClickHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack or UserActionHandling.CallBack.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotMonth.EventDelete
member.summary: This event is fired when the user clicks on a delete "X" button in the upper-right corner of an event.
member.remarks: In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind(). If this event is called using a CallBack, call Update() to redraw the events.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotMonth.EventDoubleClick
member.summary: Fires when a user double-clicks an event.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotMonth.EventSelect
member.summary: Fires when a user selects an event.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotMonth.EventMove
member.summary: This event is fired when a user moves an event by dragging.
member.remarks:
When user starts moving the event, a shadow outlining the new position appears. When the mouse button is released, this event is fired on the server.
In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind() and Update(). After calling Update() the events will be updated on the client-side.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotMonth.EventResize
member.summary: This event is fired when a user resizes an event by top or bottom border dragging.
member.remarks:
When user starts resizing the event, a shadow outlining the new size appears. When the mouse button is released, this event is fired on the server.
In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind() and Update(). After calling Update() the events will be updated on the client-side.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotMonth.TimeRangeSelected
member.summary: This event is fired when a user clicks a time cell or selects cells by mouse dragging.
member.remarks: This event is only fired if TimeRangeSelectedHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack. Otherwise it is handled on the client-side by JavaScript method specified by TimeRangeSelectedJavaScript property.

member.summary: Set to false to disable double clicking on this calendar event on the client-side.

member.name: T:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Enums.TimeRangeSelectedHandling
member.summary: UserActionHandling enumeration defines possible types of user event handling.
member.remarks:
The user action can be handled in several ways:
on the client-side by custom JavaScript code(JavaScript)
on the server-side using a PostBack request (PostBack)
on the server-side using an AJAX callback request (CallBack)
it can be disabled at all (Disabled)

member.summary: The user action will call an AJAX CallBack event.

member.summary: This functionality is disabled at all.

member.summary: Selection remains active but doesn't fire any action.

member.summary: Selection remains active but doesn't fire any action. It stays active even after callback.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.CallBack
member.summary: A shortcut to properties that can be updated during full Update().

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.Command
member.summary: This event is fired using client-side .commandCallBack() function. Use it to refresh the control using fast callback.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.EventResize
member.summary: This event is fired when a user resizes an event by top or bottom border dragging.
member.remarks:
When user starts resizing the event, a shadow outlining the new size appears. When the mouse button is released, this event is fired on the server.
In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind() and Update(). After calling Update() the events will be updated on the client-side.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.EventMove
member.summary: This event is fired when a user moves an event by dragging.
member.remarks:
When user starts moving the event, a shadow outlining the new position appears. When the mouse button is released, this event is fired on the server.
In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind() and Update(). After calling Update() the events will be updated on the client-side.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.EventClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user clicks an event.
member.remarks: This event is only fired if EventClickHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack or UserActionHandling.CallBack. Otherwise it is handled on the client-side by JavaScript method specified by EventClickJavaScript property.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.EventSelect
member.summary: Fires when the user selects an event.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.EventDelete
member.summary: This event is fired when the user clicks on a delete "X" button in the upper-right corner of an event.
member.remarks: In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind(). If this event is called using a CallBack, call Update() to redraw the events.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.EventDoubleClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user double-clicks an event.
member.remarks: This event is only fired if EventDoubleClickHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack or UserActionHandling.CallBack. Otherwise it is handled on the client-side by JavaScript method specified by EventClickJavaScript property.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.Notify
member.summary: Fires when queued client-side operations are notified to the server.

member.summary: Fires when client-side EventUpdate event is notified to the server.

member.summary: Fires when client-side EventRemove event is notified to the server.

member.summary: Fires when client-side EventAdd event is notified to the server.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.EventEdit
member.summary: Fires when a user confirms event text changes (after editing).
member.remarks:
Editing must be allowed by setting EventClickHandling to Edit.
This event is only fired if EventEditHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack. Otherwise it is handled on the client-side by JavaScript method specified by EventClickJavaScript property.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.EventRightClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user clicks an event with a right mouse button.
member.remarks: This event is only fired if EventRightClickHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack or UserActionHandling.CallBack.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.EventMenuClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user selects context menu item where the MenuItem.Action is set to or .
member.remarks: It is called when a user selects context menu item where the MenuItem.Action is set to or . In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind() and Update(). After calling Update() the events will be updated on the client-side.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.UseEventBoxes
member.summary: When set to Always (default) events are shown in boxes that are aligned with the cell size. Set to Never or ShortEventsOnly if you want to show events in real length.
member.remarks:
By default, event boxes are aligned with the cell size.
When that value is set to ShortEventsOnly the events will be rendered in real size. Events shorter than a cell size will be rendered in a box unles you set this property to Never.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.ViewType

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotScheduler.AfterEventRenderJavaScript
member.summary: The JavaScript code that will be executed after rendering an event on the client side. Two variables are available: e (Event object), div (event DIV element).

member.name: T:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Enums.EventRightClickHandlingEnum
member.summary: EventRightClickHandlingEnum enumeration defines possible types of user right mouse click handling.
member.remarks:
The user action can be handled in several ways:
on the server-side using a PostBack request (PostBack)
on the server-side using an AJAX callback request (CallBack)
on the client-side by custom JavaScript code(JavaScript)
on the client-side by showing the context menu (ContextMenu)
it can be disabled at all (Disabled)

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Enums.EventRightClickHandlingEnum.JavaScript
member.summary: The user action will run a JavaScript function.

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Enums.EventRightClickHandlingEnum.PostBack
member.summary: The user action will call a PostBack event.

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Enums.EventRightClickHandlingEnum.CallBack
member.summary: The user action will call an AJAX CallBack event.

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Enums.EventRightClickHandlingEnum.Disabled
member.summary: This functionality is disabled at all.

member.summary: Context menu will appear.

member.summary: A bubble will be activated.

member.name: T:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Enums.EventClickHandlingEnum
member.summary: EventClickHandlingEnum enumeration defines possible types of user click handling.
member.remarks:
The user action can be handled in several ways:
on the server-side using a PostBack request (PostBack)
on the server-side using an AJAX callback request (CallBack)
on the client-side by custom JavaScript code(JavaScript)
on the client-side by entering edit mode for the event (Edit)
it can be disabled at all (Disabled)

member.summary: The user action will run a JavaScript function.

member.summary: The user action will call a PostBack event.

member.summary: The user action will call an AJAX CallBack event.

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Enums.EventClickHandlingEnum.Disabled
member.summary: This functionality is disabled at all.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.BeforeCellRender
member.summary: This event is fired before cells (calendar time slots) are rendered.
member.remarks: By handling this event, it is possible to change cell properties like IsBusiness, BackgroundColor etc.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.BeforeEventRender
member.summary: This event is fired before events are rendered.
member.remarks: By handling this event, it is possible to change event box properties like DurationBarColor, BackgroundColor etc.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.BeforeHeaderRender
member.summary: This event is fired before column header is rendered.
member.remarks: By handling this event, it is possible to change column header properties like InnerHTML or ToolTip.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.BeforeTimeHeaderRender
member.summary: Use this event to modify the hour header cells.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.BeforeEventRecurrence
member.summary: This event is fired during event loading.
member.remarks: By handling this event, it is possible to extract recurrence rule from custom database fields.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.TimeRangeSelected
member.summary: This event is fired when a user clicks a time cell or selects cells by mouse dragging.
member.remarks: This event is only fired if TimeRangeSelectedHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack. Otherwise it is handled on the client-side by JavaScript method specified by TimeRangeSelectedJavaScript property.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.TimeRangeDoubleClick
member.summary: Fires when a user double-clicks a selected time range. TimeRangeDoubleClickHandling must be set to PostBack or CallBack.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.EventClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user clicks an event.
member.remarks: This event is only fired if EventClickHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack or UserActionHandling.CallBack.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.EventDoubleClick
member.summary: Fires when a user double-clicks an event.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.EventSelect
member.summary: Fires when a user selects an event.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.ClientInit
member.summary: Fired during the initial page load, after the control is initialized.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.Command
member.summary: This event is fired using client-side .commandCallBack() function. Use it to refresh the control using fast callback.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.TimeRangeMenuClick
member.summary: Fires when a user clicks a menu item. MenuItem.Action must be set to PostBack or CallBack.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.HeaderClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user clicks a column header.
member.remarks: This event is only fired if HeaderClickHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack or UserActionHandling.CallBack.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.EventRightClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user clicks an event with a right mouse button.
member.remarks: This event is only fired if EventRightClickHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack or UserActionHandling.CallBack.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.EventEdit
member.summary: Fires when a user confirms event text changes (after editing).
member.remarks:
Editing must be allowed by setting EventClickHandling to Edit.
This event is only fired if EventEditHandling property is set to UserActionHandling.PostBack. Otherwise it is handled on the client-side by JavaScript method specified by EventClickJavaScript property.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.EventResize
member.summary: This event is fired when a user resizes an event by top or bottom border dragging.
member.remarks:
When user starts resizing the event, a shadow outlining the new size appears. When the mouse button is released, this event is fired on the server.
In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind() and Update(). After calling Update() the events will be updated on the client-side.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.EventMove
member.summary: This event is fired when a user moves an event by dragging.
member.remarks:
When user starts moving the event, a shadow outlining the new position appears. When the mouse button is released, this event is fired on the server.
In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind() and Update(). After calling Update() the events will be updated on the client-side.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.EventDelete
member.summary: This event is fired when a user clicks on a delete "X" button in the upper right corner of an event.
member.remarks: In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind(). If this event is called using a CallBack, call Update() to redraw the events.

member.name: E:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.EventMenuClick
member.summary: This event is fired when a user selects context menu item where the MenuItem.Action is set to or .
member.remarks: It is called when a user selects context menu item where the MenuItem.Action is set to or . In the custom event handler you should decide whether the action is allowed. If so, update the persistent data storage (such as a database), call DataBind() and Update(). After calling Update() the events will be updated on the client-side.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.DayPilotCalendar.UseEventBoxes
member.summary: When set to Always (default) events are shown in boxes that are aligned with the cell size. Set to Never or ShortEventsOnly if you want to show events in real length.
member.remarks:
By default, event boxes are aligned with the cell size. E.g. for CellsPerHour="2" the cell size is 30 minutes. In that case, event with duration from 10:15 to 10:45 will be rendered in a box with size 10:00-11:00.
When that value is set to ShortEventsOnly the events will be rendered in real size. Events shorter than a cell size will be rendered in a box unles you set this property to Never.

member.name: T:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Enums.UserActionHandling
member.summary: UserActionHandling enumeration defines possible types of user event handling.
member.remarks:
The user action can be handled in several ways:
on the client-side by custom JavaScript code(JavaScript)
on the server-side using a PostBack request (PostBack)
on the server-side using an AJAX callback request (CallBack)
it can be disabled at all (Disabled)

member.summary: The user action will run a JavaScript function.

member.summary: The user action will call a PostBack event.

member.summary: The user action will call an AJAX CallBack event.

member.name: F:DayPilot.Web.Ui.Enums.UserActionHandling.Disabled
member.summary: This functionality is disabled at all.

member.name: P:DayPilot.Web.Ui.MenuItem.Command
member.summary: Menu item command.
member.remarks:
When MenuItem.Action is set to MenuItemAction.CallBack or MenuItemAction.PostBack the command is passed to DayPilotCalendar.EventMenuClick event.
When MenuItem.Action is set to MenuItemAction.JavaScript it is passed to the JavaScript event handler.
The typical commands will be "Delete" or "Open".
